events.title: Haiti Declares Independence
events.description: On January 1, 1804, Haiti proclaimed its independence from France, completing the Haitian Revolution and establishing the first independent Black republic.
events.significance: A landmark in anti-colonial struggle and abolition, influencing future movements for independence and abolition in the Caribbean.

events.title: Emancipation Proclamation Takes Effect
events.description: The Emancipation Proclamation, issued by President Abraham Lincoln, declared the freedom of enslaved people in Confederate-held territories and reframed the Civil War as a fight against slavery.
events.significance: Reoriented the war’s purpose, paved the path toward abolition and the 13th Amendment.

events.title: Federation of Australia
events.description: The six Australian colonies united to form the Commonwealth of Australia, creating a single federal nation.
events.significance: Birth of modern Australia and a model for federation within the British Empire.

events.title: Cuban Revolution Reaches Power
events.description: Fidel Castro’s forces seized control of Havana as Batista fled the country, marking the triumph of the Cuban Revolution.
events.significance: Transforms Caribbean politics and reshapes Cold War dynamics, influencing U.S.–Cuba relations for decades.

events.title: NAFTA Comes Into Force
events.description: The North American Free Trade Agreement entered into force among the United States, Canada, and Mexico, creating a trilateral trade bloc.
events.significance: Significant reshaping of North American trade and economic integration, with lasting impacts on industries and labor.
